sanger.math.set
Class NaturalSpace

java.lang.Object
  sanger.math.set.NaturalSpace

public class NaturalSpace
extends java.lang.Object

A continuous and finit space of natural numbers. A NaturalSpace is always continuous and provides the facility to define NaturalDomain objects contained in it. It provides NaturalDomain objects with facilities for move between the relative and absolute coordinate system so that memory complexity of NaturalSpace does not depand on its min and max values but only on its cardinality.

Author:
Lior Galanti

Constructor Detail

NaturalSpace

public NaturalSpace(int min,
                    int max)
             throws NaturalSetException
Constructs a NaturalSpace spanning from min to max. A NaturalSpace cannot be empty.

Parameters:
min - The smallest element in the space
max - The largest element in the space
Throws:
NaturalSetException - If the space is empty
Method Detail

toRelativeCoordinate

protected int toRelativeCoordinate(int position)
                            throws NaturalSetException
Translates position to the relative coordinate system. In the relative coordinate system the smallest element is always 0.

Parameters:
position - A natural number in the absolute coordinate system.
Returns:
The relative position.
Throws:
NaturalSetException - If the position is not contained in the space.

toAbsoluteCoordinate

protected int toAbsoluteCoordinate(int position)
                            throws NaturalSetException
Translates position to the absolute cooridinate system. In the absolute coordinate system the smallest element is the min.

Parameters:
position - A natural number in the relative coordinate system.
Returns:
The absolute position.
Throws:
NaturalSetException - If the position is not contained in the space.

last

public int last()
Returns:
The largest element in the relative coordinates.

one

public org.apache.solr.util.OpenBitSet one()
Returns:
An OpenBitSet with elements in the space. The one vector is in the relative coordinate system, so the first bit is the min element. This is useful when performing binary operations on sets in the space.

cardinality

public int cardinality()
Returns:
The cardinality of the space.
